1.brief: to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
a contemplation; by implication, an utterance
a (sudden) alarm (properly, the object feared, by implication, the feeling)
to guard, in a good sense (to protect, maintain, obey, etc.) or a bad one (to conceal, etc.)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively

2.brief: to hide (by covering), literally or figuratively
a session, i.e. company of persons (in close deliberation); by implication, intimacy, consultation, a secret
properly, to spoil (literally, by breaking to pieces); figuratively, to make (or be) good fornothing, i.e. bad (physically, socially or morally)
to do or make (systematically and habitually), especially to practise
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol

3.brief: who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to point (transitive or intransitive); intensively, to pierce; figuratively, to inculcate
drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)
to tread; by implication, to walk; also to string abow (by treading on it in bending)
properly, a piercer, i.e. an arrow; by implication, a wound; figuratively, (of God) thunderbolt; the shaft of aspear
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
bitter (literally or figuratively); also (as noun) bitterness, or (adverbially) bitterly

4.brief: properly, to flow as water (i.e. to rain); transitively, to lay or throw (especially an arrow, i.e. to shoot); figuratively, to point out (as if by aiming the finger), to teach
properly, a concealer, i.e. a covert
complete; usually (morally) pious; specifically, gentle, dear
properly, to flow as water (i.e. to rain); transitively, to lay or throw (especially an arrow, i.e. to shoot); figuratively, to point out (as if by aiming the finger), to teach
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten

5.brief: to fasten upon; hence, to seize, be strong (figuratively, courageous, causatively strengthen, cure, help, repair, fortify), obstinate; to bind, restrain, conquer
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
properly, to score with a mark as a tally or record, i.e. (by implication) to inscribe, and also to enumerate; intensively, to recount, i.e. celebrate
a noose (for catching animals) (literally or figuratively); by implication, a hook (for the nose)
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)

6.brief: to seek; causatively, to conceal oneself (i.e. let be sought), or mask
to complete, in a good or a bad sense, literal, or figurative, transitive or intransitive
to seek; causatively, to conceal oneself (i.e. let be sought), or mask
properly, the nearest part, i.e. the center, whether literal, figurative or adverbial (especially with preposition)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

7.brief: properly, to flow as water (i.e. to rain); transitively, to lay or throw (especially an arrow, i.e. to shoot); figuratively, to point out (as if by aiming the finger), to teach

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, a piercer, i.e. an arrow; by implication, a wound; figuratively, (of God) thunderbolt; the shaft of aspear
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a wound; figuratively, carnage, also pestilence

8.brief: to totter or waver (through weakness of the legs, especially the ankle); by implication, to falter, stumble, faint or fall
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)
properly, to wave to and fro (rarely to flap up and down); figuratively, to rove, flee, or (causatively) to drive away
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)

9.brief: to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)

properly, to front, i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to manifest; figuratively, to announce (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to expose, predict, explain, praise

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
an action (good or bad); generally, a transaction; abstractly, activity; by implication, a product (specifically, a poem) or (generally) property
to be (causatively, make or act) circumspect and hence, intelligent

10.brief: probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to flee for protection; figuratively, to confide in
to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to flee for protection; figuratively, to confide in
to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
